intro: Euclea natalensis subsp. angolensis, commonly known as the Angola euclea, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its small, oval-shaped leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its fruit is a small, smooth capsule that contains several seeds. This species is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
